name: Hideki Tojo (東條英機)
description: Prime Minister of Japan during WWII who authorized Pearl Harbor attack. Executed as war criminal for atrocities including treatment of POWs.

name: Franklin D. Roosevelt
description: US President through Great Depression and WWII. New Deal transformed American government, led Allies to brink of victory, died in office.

name: Winston Churchill
description: British Prime Minister who rallied Britain during WWII with stirring speeches. "We shall never surrender" - symbol of defiance against Nazi Germany.

name: Charles de Gaulle
description: Led Free French during WWII, founded Fifth Republic. Towering figure who restored French pride and pursued independent foreign policy.

name: Francisco Franco
description: Fascist dictator who ruled Spain for 36 years after winning Civil War. Allied with Hitler and Mussolini, kept Spain neutral in WWII.

name: Harry S. Truman
description: US President who dropped atomic bombs on Japan, began Cold War containment, and desegregated military. "The buck stops here."

name: Dwight D. Eisenhower
description: WWII Supreme Allied Commander then US President. Warned of "military-industrial complex," presided over 1950s prosperity and Cold War tensions.

name: John F. Kennedy
description: Youngest elected US President whose assassination shocked world. Cuban Missile Crisis, space race, civil rights, inspiring rhetoric cut short.

name: Lyndon B. Johnson
description: US President who passed landmark Civil Rights Act and Great Society programs. Legacy overshadowed by escalation of Vietnam War.

name: Richard Nixon
description: US President who opened relations with China, ended Vietnam War, but resigned in disgrace over Watergate scandal. Complex legacy.

name: Ronald Reagan
description: Conservative US President who challenged Soviet Union to "tear down this wall." Reaganomics, ended Cold War, transformed Republican Party.

name: George H.W. Bush
description: US President who oversaw end of Cold War and Gulf War. "Thousand points of light," diplomatic skill, one-term presidency.

name: Bill Clinton
description: US President who presided over 1990s prosperity and tech boom. Impeached over Monica Lewinsky scandal but remained popular, skilled politician.

name: George W. Bush
description: US President defined by 9/11 response and Iraq War. Controversial legacy of War on Terror, financial crisis at end of presidency.

name: Joe Biden
description: Current US President, oldest ever elected. Long Senate career, Obama VP, defeated Trump, focused on infrastructure and climate.

name: Nikita Khrushchev
description: Soviet leader who denounced Stalin, Cuban Missile Crisis, built Berlin Wall. "We will bury you" but pursued peaceful coexistence.

name: Leonid Brezhnev
description: Soviet leader during period of stagnation. Invaded Czechoslovakia and Afghanistan, presided over nuclear parity with US.

name: Boris Yeltsin
description: First president of post-Soviet Russia. Dissolved USSR, introduced capitalism chaotically, defended White House against coup.

name: Josip Broz Tito
description: Communist leader who kept Yugoslavia independent from Soviet Union. Held multi-ethnic country together, non-aligned movement leader.

name: Jawaharlal Nehru
description: First Prime Minister of independent India. Architect of non-aligned movement, secular democracy, socialist economic policies.

name: Indira Gandhi
description: First female Prime Minister of India, daughter of Nehru. Strong leader who declared emergency, assassinated by Sikh bodyguards.

name: Benazir Bhutto
description: First female Prime Minister of Muslim-majority country. Charismatic leader from prominent family, assassinated while campaigning.

name: Park Chung-hee (박정희)
description: Military dictator who transformed South Korea into economic powerhouse. Authoritarian but effective, assassinated by intelligence chief.

name: Deng Xiaoping (鄧小平)
description: Chinese leader who opened China to market reforms. "To get rich is glorious" - transformed China into economic superpower after Mao.

name: Ho Chi Minh (胡志明)
description: Communist revolutionary who led Vietnam to independence from France and war against US. National hero, Saigon renamed for him.

name: Lee Kuan Yew
description: Founded modern Singapore, transforming it from third-world to first-world. Authoritarian but effective "benevolent dictator."

name: Suharto
description: Indonesian dictator for 31 years who brought stability and economic growth but massive corruption. Resigned during 1998 financial crisis.

name: Corazon Aquino
description: First female Philippine President who led People Power Revolution overthrowing Marcos. Restored democracy, symbol of peaceful change.

name: Gamal Abdel Nasser
description: Egyptian leader who nationalized Suez Canal, championed pan-Arabism. Hero to Arab world, challenged Western influence.

name: Anwar Sadat
description: Egyptian president who made peace with Israel at Camp David. Won Nobel Prize but assassinated by Islamic extremists.

name: Golda Meir
description: First female Prime Minister of Israel, "Iron Lady" who led during Yom Kippur War. Chain-smoking grandmother image, tough negotiator.

name: Ayatollah Khomeini
description: Islamic revolutionary who overthrew Shah, established theocratic Iran. Anti-Western, issued fatwa against Rushdie, Iran-Iraq War.

name: Hafez al-Assad
description: Syrian dictator who ruled with iron fist for 30 years. Brutal suppression of dissent, father of Bashar al-Assad.

name: Muammar Gaddafi
description: Libyan dictator known for eccentric behavior and terrorism sponsorship. Arab Spring uprising led to NATO intervention and brutal death.

name: Kwame Nkrumah
description: Led Ghana to independence, first sub-Saharan African nation to do so. Pan-Africanist visionary, overthrown in coup.

name: Jomo Kenyatta
description: Led Kenya to independence from Britain. "Father of the Nation," balanced tribalism with nation-building.

name: Julius Nyerere
description: Tanzanian president who pursued African socialism (Ujamaa). Respected elder statesman despite economic failures.

name: Idi Amin
description: Brutal Ugandan dictator who killed 300,000+ people. Expelled Asians, bizarre personality, overthrown and exiled.

name: Robert Mugabe
description: Led Zimbabwe from liberation hero to authoritarian ruler. Land seizures destroyed economy, hyperinflation, finally removed in coup.

name: F.W. de Klerk
description: Last apartheid-era South African president who negotiated with Mandela to end apartheid. Shared Nobel Prize, controversial legacy.

name: Patrice Lumumba
description: First Prime Minister of independent Congo, assassinated with Western involvement. Martyr of African independence, Cold War victim.

name: Juan Perón
description: Argentine populist leader with wife Evita. Peronism dominated Argentine politics for decades, mix of socialism and nationalism.

name: Eva Perón (Evita)
description: First Lady of Argentina, beloved by working class. "Don't cry for me Argentina" - died young, became political icon.

name: Che Guevara
description: Revolutionary icon who fought alongside Castro. Left Cuba to spread revolution, killed in Bolivia, face became global symbol.

name: Salvador Allende
description: First Marxist elected president in Latin America. Overthrown in CIA-backed coup, died in palace as Pinochet took power.

name: Lula da Silva
description: Working-class Brazilian president who lifted millions from poverty. Corruption scandals, imprisoned, returned to presidency. Controversial but transformative.

name: Daniel Ortega
description: Sandinista revolutionary who overthrew Somoza, now authoritarian president. From guerrilla hero to accused dictator.

name: Hosni Mubarak
description: Egyptian president for 30 years, overthrown in Arab Spring. Maintained peace with Israel, authoritarian rule, died after trial.

name: Slobodan Milošević
description: Serbian leader who orchestrated ethnic cleansing in Yugoslav Wars. First head of state tried for genocide, died during trial.

name: Helmut Kohl
description: German Chancellor who reunified Germany after fall of Berlin Wall. Longest-serving postwar chancellor, architect of European Union.

name: Tony Blair
description: British Prime Minister who modernized Labour Party. Iraq War with Bush damaged legacy despite domestic achievements.

name: Silvio Berlusconi
description: Media mogul who dominated Italian politics despite scandals. Three-time prime minister, controversial "bunga bunga" parties, legal troubles.

name: Aung San Suu Kyi
description: Democracy icon who spent years under house arrest, won Nobel Prize. Led Myanmar government but legacy ruined by Rohingya genocide.
